resources.string: Risk of harm from unprotected sun exposure,\nfor the average adult

Wear sunglasses on bright days;
use sunscreen if there is snow on the ground,
which reflects UV radiation,
or if you have particularly fair skin.
Take precautions, such as covering up, if you will be outside.\nStay in shade near midday when the sun is strongest.

Cover the body with sun protective clothing,
use SPF 30+ sunscreen, wear a hat,
reduce time in the sun within three hours of solar noon,
and wear sunglasses.
Wear SPF 30+ sunscreen, a shirt,\nsunglasses, and a wide-brimmed hat.\nDo not stay in the sun for too long.

Take all precautions: Wear SPF 30+ sunscreen,
a long-sleeved shirt and trousers, sunglasses,
and a very broad hat.
Avoid the sun within three hours of solar noon.
